howItWorks.title: Wie Multi-KAS in DIVE V3 funktioniert

uploadPhase.title: Upload Phase (Resource Creation)
uploadPhase.description: When you upload an encrypted resource, upload.service.ts automatically creates 1-4 Key Access Objects (KAOs) based on the resource's releasabilityTo and COI tags. Each KAO wraps the data encryption key (DEK) with a different KAS's public key.

accessPhase.title: Access Phase (Key Request)
accessPhase.description: When you try to view a resource, resource.service.ts selects the optimal KAS based on your attributes (country, COI membership). It sends a rewrap request to that KAS, which re-evaluates the OPA policy before releasing the key.

mongoDBSSOT.title: MongoDB as SSOT
mongoDBSSOT.description: All KAS registrations are stored in kas_registry collection. Health metrics, heartbeats, and federation agreements are tracked in real-time. The dashboard you're viewing now fetches live data from MongoDB every 30 seconds.

dataSource.title: Data Source:
dataSource.description: This dashboard displays real KAS instances from the MongoDB kas_registry collection. Metrics are aggregated from audit_log for request counts and response times.

instantGrowth.title: Instant Coalition Growth
instantGrowth.description: Add new coalition partners in minutes by deploying a spoke KAS. No re-encryption needed for existing resources.

sovereignty.title: National Key Sovereignty
sovereignty.description: Each nation controls its own KAS. Keys never leave national boundaries without explicit policy approval.

policyDriven.title: Policy-Driven Access
policyDriven.description: OPA policies evaluated at each KAS ensure only authorized users with proper clearances can access resources.

zeroReencryption.title: Zero Re-encryption
zeroReencryption.description: Resources encrypted once, accessible by multiple KAS endpoints. No need to re-encrypt when adding partners.

certificates.title: Certificate Compliance
certificates.subtitle: TLS certificate validation and trust management
certificates.subject: Subject

description.unclassified: Information that does not meet the standards for classification
description.confidential: Information that could cause damage to national security if disclosed
description.secret: Information that could cause serious damage to national security if disclosed
description.topSecret: Information that could cause exceptionally grave damage to national security if disclosed

coiKeys.title: Community of Interest (COI) Keys
coiKeys.subtitle: Coalition access control and key management
coiKeys.description: COI tags determine which KAS endpoints can decrypt resources
